item.title: What Is Nautilus mDNS
item.description: Learn how Nautilus mDNS provides automatic, decentralized service discovery using Multicast DNS (mDNS).

item.title: Architecture
item.description: Understand how Nautilus mDNS is structured, including its packet processing, service registry, and event-driven architecture.

item.title: Nautilus mDNS vs. Others
item.description: While existing Rust-based mDNS solutions like mdns-sd and libmdns provide basic service discovery, they often come with limitations in flexibility, extensibility, and long-term viability. Nautilus mDNS was built to overcome these challenges while offering a future-proof, high-performance service discovery mechanism.

item.title: Roadmap
item.description:
Nautilus mDNS is a fully functional decentralized service discovery framework with:

  • Basic mDNS Service Discovery – Devices can register and query services dynamically.
  • Multicast-Based Name Resolution – Resolves local hostnames to IP addresses without a DNS server.
  • Support for mDNS Records – Handles A, PTR, SRV, and TXT records.
  • Event-Driven Service Discovery – Listens for changes in available services in real-time.
